entry.title: How to avoid accrual aggregation when a periodic ACE run is missed?
entry.content:
Hello, gurus!

What needs to be done so that on 31.03.2025 the system generates two separate documents for –1,000 each (for February and March), both with a posting date of 31.03.2025, instead of one aggregated document?

In the scenario shown in the table:

1. 01.01.2025, an accrual object (ACACTREE01) was created for 12,000 with a validity period from 01.01.2025 to 31.12.2025.

2. 31.01.2025, ACEPOSTINGRUN was executed for January — a posting document for –1,000 was created.

3. 28.02.2025, the periodic posting run for February was not executed (Missing!).

4. 31.03.2025, when ACEPOSTINGRUN was executed, the system created one document for –2,000 (covering both February and March).

entry.title: Asset sales in Colombia withholding tax
entry.content:
We are using sales order process for asset sales to calculate with holding taxes in Colombia company code where e-invoice process is used to submit details to Colombian tax authorities. But there is no option available to link the sales order to Asset master data to use it during asset retirement process.

 Please advise if there is any SAP notes/standard process to follow for asset sales in Colombia and tax reporting.

entry.title: Clarification on OB57 User Assignment and Impact of Deletion
entry.content:
Hello ,

We have been assigning accounting users to tolerance groups in OB57 for a long time. Our current process is to assign every new user in the accounting team to OB57.

Now, we are considering deleting all users from OB57. Before proceeding, I would like to understand:

  1. What is the impact if we delete all users from OB57?
  2. What is the impact of assigning users in OB57 versus not assigning them?

Thanks

entry.title: Validation for only employee without allowance is able to submit transportation claim in Concur
entry.content:
Hi All FI, SuccessFactors, and Concur Experts.

If we may know,
currently there is an inquiry from the end-user about the feasibility of set-up a kind of validation or restriction rule to only employee that receive "monthly transport allowance" will not be able to submit "taxi/transportation charges" claim via SAP Concur system.

Would you like to kindly help us on giving advice whether there is any specific technical field or information that we could use as such an indicator to know which personel number of employee that receive "monthly transport allowance" in SAP FI or SAP SuccessFactors? to be further integrated or acknowledged (captured) by the Concur system then.

Thank you so much, and we are looking forward to discussing this with you.

Ani.

@RafaelMira @Ronak_Jhuthawat @ctf_jacqting @Michaela_Sedlicka @LeoSupriano @katharina_sorge @yogeshgsalvi @harinarasimha @siddharthrajora

entry.title: Current Support Status of MultiCash Format in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I hope you are doing well.

I am currently working on the configuration of Bank Statements and Bank Reconciliation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, and a question has come up regarding the MultiCash format.

During our setup, we noticed that the system fully supports and recommends the MT940 bank statement format; however, MultiCash does not appear as a selectable or predefined format in the standard configuration parameters of the Public Cloud Edition.

My questions for the community are:

  1. Is MultiCash officially supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508?

  2. If so, what is the expected process to enable or integrate this format, considering that it is not available in the standard bank statement import apps (e.g., Manage Bank Statements, Manage Incoming Payment Files)?

  3. Is SAP providing any recommended approach (e.g., Integration Suite mapping, alternative formats, or upcoming updates) for customers who still work with MultiCash and need to import these files into the Public Cloud environment?

I would really appreciate any guidance, official references, or insights based on experience with MultiCash in S/4HANA Cloud Public.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: cl_cte_fin_post_ccard_services=>get_ccard_nr_from_token
entry.content:
Hello Team, 

We are using the method cl_cte_fin_post_ccard_services=>get_ccard_nr_from_token to retrieve the credit card number from the given token.

However, the method is now failing with the error “http_communication_failure”.
We have checked the CONCUR RFC connection in SM59, and it is working fine, but we are not sure why the communication failure is occurring.

Error details:

http_communication_failure
CONCUR RFC
500 Native SSL error
ICM_HTTP_SSL_ERROR

Has anyone encountered this type of issue before?
Are there any prerequisites or configuration settings that should be checked?
This interface had been working for many days, and the error has started appearing suddenly.

Please find some example asset list for your reference :

105050015409
107000014373
107000014553

So requesting you kindly help us how we can stop depreciation and guide us on the process to reverse the depreciation amount in case the particular asset has been posted with depreciation beyond 29th April ,2025.

entry.title: TDS Limit in SAP Based on total invoice amount for fiscal year done.
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I got a requirment from business which is i got find to done with customization with the help of enhancement,

Purpose / Objective:

The purpose of this Business requirment implementing a TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) threshold limit configuration in SAP.
Currently, the system deducts TDS on every invoice amount without checking the cumulative transaction value for each vendor at PAN.

This leads to incorrect or non-compliant deductions.

The objective of this development is to ensure that TDS is deducted only after the total transaction value for a PAN exceeds the statutory threshold limit (₹50,00,000) within a financial year.

Business Requirement

TDS should be deducted only when the cumulative invoice/payment value for a vendor PAN in a financial year exceeds ₹50,00,000.
The system must check the total amount posted for each vendor PAN from the start of the fiscal year (April) and apply TDS only when the threshold is crossed.

 

Functional Requirements:

 

TABLE

Description

INPUT Logic.

FIELD

OUTPUT                               

LFA1

Fetch Vendor by Vendor PAN detail.

Vendor PAN

J_1IPANNO

Vendor Code of same PAN

LFBW

Pass Vendor Code and get the vendor with withholding tax type 194Q-4Q

Vendor Code which I got from LFA1(J_1IPANNO)

WITHT

Vendor Details which only have TDS type 194Q-4Q

As a Functional i have created the logic but i am confuged with from which table i can pick vendor invoice amount( which is final net amount after all kind of case which can reduce vendor invoice line item except vendor payment) I triend with BSEG, But BSEG is very big table, It will not work with BSEG. Please help me with the other solution other than BSEG, I avoid BSEG here, If only BSEG help here please give a clear logic. But provide any other solution.

Can we do this by Configuration level, According to me its cannot possible because at config level its just set the invoice base amount for tds deduction but validation required on cummulative vendors at PAN level also

entry.title: How to view balance confirmation history for customer/vendor in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
Dear everyone,

as part of a S/4HANA transformation (S/4HANA on premise - 02 (10/2024) fps), I am looking to find a way to view stored document history of created balance confirmations in the past per customer/vendor, as it can be viewed in R3 via attachment list function (Transaction VD03 /VK03). I am generating balance confirmations (programm SAPF130D_PDF/SAPF130K_PDF) using transaction F17P/F18P. However, once the confirmations are generated and visible in spool, the PDFs are not centrally stored somewhere and cannot be accessed afterwards. What options do I have for that case or what need to be done in advance? 

Thank you in advance for any advice on this matter

Kind regards

entry.title: How to populated the VAT registration number for Business Partner correctly?
entry.content:
Hello dear SAP S/4HANA experts,

As part of an SAP S/4HANA migration project, I am responsible for data migration. I am currently attempting to migrate customer master data as business partners into SAP S/4HANA using the Migration Cockpit (version 12.2.24) and the migration object “Customer.”

Unfortunately, I am unable to successfully migrate the VAT registration number.

After the migration of the customer master data, the Migration Cockpit displays the warning message: Customer ##1 is from an EU country/region; enter a VAT registration number  and  VAT Registration No.: Plausibility check failed.

During the validation or simulation of the customer master data, however, no warning message appears.

The most recent XML template contains four separate sheets related to VAT information.

 

 

 

I have tried various combinations that came to mind, but unfortunately without success. I would greatly appreciate any further suggestions.

My question is:

How exactly must the fields be populated so that the VAT registration number is migrated correctly? 

Additionally:

Is there a way to deactivate the validation rule for "VAT registration no. plausibility check" either in Customizing or in the Migration Object Modeler (LTMOM)?
